intro: Sphaeralcea pedata var. angustiloba, commonly known as narrowleaf globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, characterized by its showy, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and grayish-green, and it produces spherical seed heads that give it its common name. It is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats.
